item.description:
Hey Group,
I've come across this interesting paper by Henry Stapp and some neuropsychologists making the case for the Copenhagen interpretation in the mind/body problem --- and in psychological practice! (Whoa, dude... )
The paper is posted in the "Files" section of the site.

My personal take on the paper is that their point is not as hopelessly goofy as it sounds at first reading, but is actually a fairly straight-forward result of taking Bohr and von Neumann's interpretations of QM seriously. That being said, I'm not sure if I think their arguments really work in the end, but it's very good read in any case.

I'll prepare a few PP slides to present summarizing the paper that we can then rip apart.

When you RSVP, let me know if you're up for pizza again like last time.

See you there!
Sean

group.name: The Boston Philosophy of Mind Group

item.name: Whoa-Dude: It's Quantum Psychology!
